alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 16 at 5:38PM AKST until February 17 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with highest amounts from Dillingham north. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibilities reduced to one half mile. * WHERE...Bristol Bay, north and west of King Salmon. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 9 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong front is expected to bring snow, gusty southwesterly winds, and reduced visibilities to the Bristol Bay coast this evening. Snow and winds will progress inland from south to north through the night. The highest snowfall amounts are expected to occur Thursday night from Dillingham north. By Friday morning, the main front will push north of the area and steady snow will turn to snow showers, which should allow visibility to improve.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
